intro: Huperzia hastata, commonly known as the rock huperzia, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen, leathery fronds that are typically short and clustered. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Asia, Europe, and North America. Huperzia hastata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices and forest floors. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
